about_the_game:
What is You Make The Game?

Welcome to You Make The Game, a community-driven game development experience! We want to create a game based on YOUR ideas and feedback. This project is an ongoing prototype, updated regularly with new features based on your input. If you’ve ever wanted to help shape a game from the ground up, this is your chance!

How Does It Work?

  • Play the latest build of the game and experiment with what we’ve made so far.
  • Share your thoughts, ideas, and feedback in our Discord or drop a comment on our latest YouTube dev logs.
  • Watch the game evolve! We release updates based on community feedback, and you’ll see your ideas come to life.

Why Are We Doing This?

We’re a small team of two devs working part-time on You Make The Game. After releasing our previous game Block-ed, we realized how much fun it would be to involve the community from the start. We love working on creative games, but we also know that the best games are built with the players in mind. That’s where you come in!

What You Can Expect:

  • Regular updates that incorporate community ideas
  • Full transparency on development progress through dev logs
  • An open and welcoming environment to share your thoughts and suggestions

Features

  • Community-Driven Development: Your ideas help shape the game! Suggest mechanics, features, or anything else you think would be fun.
  • Regular Updates: Each new YouTube video dev log brings new features to the game. Playtest them and give feedback to guide the next steps.
  • Interactive Community: Join our Discord to discuss your ideas directly with us and other players. Together, we'll brainstorm, build, and refine the game.
  • Fun and Experimental Gameplay: The game is still in its early stages, but every update will bring new elements for you to explore. Whether it's level design, mechanics, or art style—we're figuring it out together!

Why Your Ideas Matter

In You Make The Game, we aim to build something that YOU want to play. Every suggestion, no matter how big or small, helps us craft the best possible experience. We can’t promise that every idea will make it into the game, but we do promise to listen and consider all feedback. Keep in mind, we’re a small team working part-time, so while we can’t implement everything, we love working with the community to figure out what’s most fun!

Note on Submitting Ideas:
By submitting ideas, you agree that they’re shared freely with no expectation of compensation. We want this to be a fun, collaborative process, so if you’re not comfortable with your ideas being used this way, please refrain from participating in the discussions.

Development Plans

We’re aiming for about a year of development, though the exact timeline depends on how the project evolves. Because the game is shaped by community input, the scope might change as we explore different ideas together. We’ll share progress through regular updates on Steam and YouTube, so you’ll always know what we’re working on.

Join The Conversation!

Want to help make this game awesome? Here’s how you can get involved:

  • Play the game and see what we’ve built so far.
  • Join our Discord to chat with us and other players about what you’d like to see in the game.
  • Watch our YouTube dev logs to see how the game is progressing and leave your feedback in the comments.
We’re incredibly excited to work with you all to build something unique and fun. We hope you’ll love being part of this journey as much as we do!

FAQ

Q: What is You Make The Game?
A: It’s a prototype game where the community helps shape the development. Play early versions, share your ideas, and see your suggestions implemented in future updates.

Q: How can I give feedback or suggest ideas?
A: After playing the game, join our Discord or leave a comment on our YouTube videos. We’re constantly reviewing community input and will use it to guide development.

Q: How often is the game updated?
A: We release updates regularly alongside our YouTube dev logs, showcasing new features, mechanics, and improvements based on community feedback.

Q: Can I get paid for my ideas?
A: Your ideas are submitted freely without compensation. The reward is seeing your suggestions come to life in the game! If you’re not okay with that, we recommend not participating.

Q: What’s the scope of development?
A: We’re targeting about a year of development, but this could change depending on the feedback we receive and the scope of the project.

Q: Can any idea be implemented?
A: We’re open to all kinds of ideas, but since we’re a small team, we can’t promise to implement everything. That said, we’re always looking for fun, creative ideas to enhance the game!

Q: How can I stay updated?
A: Subscribe to our YouTube channel for dev logs, and join our Discord for discussions and updates. You’ll always be in the loop!

Q: What kind of atmosphere do you expect from the community?
A: We want to keep things fun and constructive. No idea is a bad idea, and we aim to maintain a respectful and friendly environment in both Discord and YouTube comments.

Want to help make You Make The Game the best it can be? Join the community, share your ideas, and let’s build something awesome together!

  • Join our Discord
  • Subscribe on YouTube

Minimum:
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: CPU: 3GHz DualCore (Intel Pentium G3220 or higher / AMD A4-4000 or higher)
  • Memory: 1 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Nvidia GeForce 550 or better / ATI Radeon HD 5850 or better
  • Storage: 1 GB available space
  • Sound Card: DirectX Compatible Sound Card
  • Additional Notes: Requirements might change during development, but we will try to support low spec computers
